newsitem.title: SPAIN: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.

text.p: Spanish government bonds closed slightly higher on Tuesday, after erasing all initial losses.

Though good results at the three- and 10-year auction this morning supported bonos, dealers were relcutant to push for further gains in the short term, before Wednesday's five- and 15-year bond auction.
"But after that, the Spanish market could rally again because the general mood is really still very positive," said a dealer in Madrid.
December currency reserves rose in Spain by 1,641.8 million dollars to 61.828.4.
A year ago, Spain's currency reserves were almost half that at 38,233.1 million dollars.
"We saw big interest from foreign investors in the last year, and this trend is expected to go also this year," a dealer in Madrid said.
But more room was seen in the short-end of the curve. While the three-year bond yield declined on Tuesday, the ten-year bond yield rose a little over the seven percent level.
